name: Trevor Crosby, Ph.D.
label: Data & Machine Learning Scientist
summary: AI/ML leader with experience building production-grade machine learning systems to solve complex challenges at scale.

highlights: In my current role at John Deere, I develop AI/ML tools that make use of complex, multimodal data like images, sensor readings, and text. I focus on building large-scale systems and products that use this data to support smarter decisions and more efficient operations. My work also includes simplifying workflows with AI tools and guiding projects from early design into deployment while mentoring teammates and providing technical leadership.

At Corteva, I applied machine learning to help inform agricultural decisions using a variety of geospatial, environmental, and biological data. I worked on models for prediction and recommendation, and contributed to tools that supported more personalized, data-driven choices. My focus included full-lifecycle development and cross-team collaboration.

During my Ph.D., I led research at the intersection of remote sensing, machine learning, and agriculture. I worked with aerial imagery to create models that helped farmers rapidly respond to spatio-temporally variable factors impacting their crop's yield, quality, and fertility. My academic work laid the foundation for my applied ML skills and strengthened my ability to lead, teach, and communicate across disciplines.

volunteer_experience.summary: As an organizer for Seattle Data Professionals, I lead biweekly meetups focused on connecting local scientists, engineers, and analysts in the data and machine learning field. I help grow the community and encourage knowledge sharing, career development, and meaningful connections.

As a guest lecturer for Seattle SDE Skills, I deliver interactive whiteboarding sessions on core topics in machine learning, data science, and software engineering. Some of my previous talks include a deep dive into gradient descent, an introduction to SQL fundamentals, and an applied walkthrough of graph algorithms.

degrees: Bachelor of Science in Plant Science
Minor in Management and Sales in Agribusiness

skills.name: Python, SQL, Git, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Spark, Databricks, GenAI, LLMs, CVML, Vector Databases, CI/CD, Agile
